intro: Amitostigma microhemipilia, commonly known as the dwarf larkspur, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in late spring. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces blue or purple flowers with five petals. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
